question: 61. How many security groups can you attach to a single instance in a VPC?
options: D. 2 or more
C. 1 or more
A. None, security groups aren’t attached to instances.
answers: C. 1 or more

question: 62. Which of the following can be added to a VPC, in addition to security groups on included instances, to further secure the VPC?
options: A. A NACL
C. An ALB
B. A port filter
D. A flow log
answers: A. A NACL

question: 63. Which of the following statements is true about a custom, user-created NACL?
options: C. A NACL is a virtual firewall for associated subnets.
D. A NACL functions at the instance level.
A. A NACL by default allows all traffic out of a VPC.
B. A NACL by default allows all traffic into a VPC.
answers: C. A NACL is a virtual firewall for associated subnets.

question: 64. What do you use to permit and restrict control of a NACL?
options: B. WAF
C. AWS Organizations
A. VPC
D. IAM
answers: D. IAM

question: 65. Which of these are true about security groups? (Choose two.)
options: A. Support allow and deny rules
C. Operate at the instance level
B. Evaluate all rules before deciding whether to allow traffic
D. Apply to all instances in the associated subnet
answers: C. Operate at the instance level
B. Evaluate all rules before deciding whether to allow traffic

question: 66. Which of these are true about security groups? (Choose two.)
options: C. Process rules in order
B. Stateless
A. Stateful
D. Associated with an instance
answers: A. Stateful
D. Associated with an instance

question: 67. Which of these are true about NACLs? (Choose two.)
options: C. Process rules in order
B. Stateless
A. Stateful
D. Associated with an instance
answers: C. Process rules in order
B. Stateless

question: 68. Which of these are true about NACLs? (Choose two.)
options: C. Support allow and deny rules
B. Only apply if no security group is present
D. Evaluate all rules before deciding whether to allow or disallow traffic
A. Apply to all instances in an associated subnet
answers: C. Support allow and deny rules
A. Apply to all instances in an associated subnet

question: 69. In which order are NACLs and security groups evaluated?
options: A. NACLs and security groups are evaluated in parallel.
D. It depends on the VPC setup.
C. A security group is evaluated first, and then the NACL.
B. A NACL is evaluated first, and then the security group.
answers: B. A NACL is evaluated first, and then the security group.

question: 70. Which of these statements are true? (Choose two.)
options: D. A NACL can apply to only one instance at the same time.
B. A NACL applies to all instances within a subnet at the same time.
A. A security group can apply to two instances at the same time.
C. A security group can apply to only one instance at the same time.
answers: B. A NACL applies to all instances within a subnet at the same time.
A. A security group can apply to two instances at the same time.

question: 71. With which of the following is a NACL associated?
options: B. A subnet
D. A NACL can be associated with all of these.
A. An instance
C. A VPC
answers: B. A subnet

question: 72. Which of the following are true about the default NACL that comes with the default VPC? (Choose two.)
options: D. It disallows all outbound traffic.
C. It disallows all inbound traffic.
B. It allows all outbound traffic.
A. It allows all inbound traffic.
answers: B. It allows all outbound traffic.
A. It allows all inbound traffic.

question: 73. Which of the following are true about a user-created NACL? (Choose two.)
options: D. It disallows all outbound traffic.
C. It disallows all inbound traffic.
B. It allows all outbound traffic.
A. It allows all inbound traffic.
answers: C. It disallows all inbound traffic.
D. It disallows all outbound traffic.

question: 74. In which order are rules in a NACL evaluated?
options: C. From low to high, using the port of the rule
A. From low to high, using the number on the rule
D. From high to low, using the port of the rule
B. From high to low, using the number on the rule
answers: A. From low to high, using the number on the rule

question: 75. Which of the following statements is not true? (Choose two.)
options: B. Network ACLs are stateful.
A. A network ACL has separate inbound and outbound rules.
D. A network ACL can only be associated with a single subnet.
C. Each subnet in your VPC must be associated with a NACL.
answers: B. Network ACLs are stateful.
D. A network ACL can only be associated with a single subnet.

question: 76. With how many subnets can a NACL be associated?
options: C. A NACL is associated with instances, not subnets.
A. One
D. A NACL is associated with VPCs, not subnets.
B. One or more
answers: B. One or more

question: 77. With how many NACLs can a subnet be associated?
options: A. One
C. A subnet is associated with security groups, not NACLs.
D. A subnet is associated with VPCs, not NACLs.
B. One or more
answers: A. One

question: 78. What happens when you associate a NACL with a subnet that already is associated with a different NACL?
options: D. The new NACL replaces the previous NACL, and the subnet still only has one NACL association.
A. Nothing, both NACLs are associated with the subnet.
C. You receive an error. You must first merge the two NACLs to apply them to a subnet.
B. You receive an error. You must remove the first NACL to associate the new one.
answers: D. The new NACL replaces the previous NACL, and the subnet still only has one NACL association.

question: 79. Which of the following are part of a network ACL rule? (Choose two.)
options: B. A rule number
C. An IAM group
A. An ASCII code
D. A protocol
answers: B. A rule number
D. A protocol

question: 80. Which of the following are part of a network ACL rule? (Choose two.)
options: D. A VPC identifier
B. A CIDR range
A. An ALLOW or DENY specification
C. An IP address
answers: B. A CIDR range
A. An ALLOW or DENY specification
